Surati CEO Boeing, Puluhan Ribu Pramugari AS Khawatirkan Keamanan 737 MAX
01 Nov 2019, 14:35 by Novi Christiastuti
Washington - Asosiasi pramugari maskapai American Airlines menyuarakan kekhawatiran soal keamanan pesawat Boeing 737 MAX. Dalam surat kepada CEO Boeing, asosiasi pramugari Amerika Serikat (AS) itu menuntut peran aktif dari mereka dalam peluncuran kembali pesawat yang kini di-grounded secara global itu.
Seperti dilansir Reuters, Jumat (1/11/2019), seruan itu disampaikan oleh Presiden Asosiasi Pramugari Profesional American Airlines, Lori Bassani, dalam surat yang ditujukan untuk CEO Boeing Co, Dennis Muilenburg, pekan ini.
"Sebanyak 28 ribu pramugari yang bekerja untuk American Airlines menolak untuk masuk ke dalam pesawat yang mungkin tidak aman dan menyerukan standar keamanan tertinggi untuk menghindari tragedi lainnya," ucap Bassani dalam surat yang dilihat Reuters itu.
Surat tertanggal 30 Oktober itu dikirimkan menyusul pemeriksaan Kongres AS terhadap Muilenburg yang berlangsung selama dua hari. Dalam pemeriksaan itu, Muilenburg dicecar banyak pertanyaan tajam terkait Boeing 737 MAX yang terlibat tragedi Lion Air dan Ethiopian Airlines yang menewaskan total 346 orang.
American Airlines Group diketahui merupakan pengguna Boeing 737 MAX terbanyak kedua, dengan 24 unit pesawat yang kini dimilikinya dan puluhan pesawat lainnya yang telah dipesan.
Dituturkan Bassani kepada Muilenburg bahwa pemeriksaan di Kongres AS menunjukkan kegagalan dalam pengawasan pengembangan Boeing 737 MAX dan memicu pertanyaan soal sumber daya untuk pengawasan pada Otoritas Penerbangan Federal AS (FAA).

Surati Boeing CEO, Tens of Thousands of US Stewardess Concerned about 737 MAX Security
Nov 1 2019, 14:35 by Novi Christiastuti
Washington - The American Airlines flight attendant association voiced concerns about the safety of the Boeing 737 MAX. In a letter to Boeing's CEO, the United States (US) flight attendant association demands an active role from them in the relaunch of the plane which is now globally grounded.
As reported by Reuters on Friday (1/11/2019), the call was made by the President of the American Airlines Professional Stewardess Association, Lori Bassani, in a letter addressed to Boeing Co. CEO Dennis Muilenburg, this week.
"As many as 28 thousand flight attendants who work for American Airlines refuse to get into potentially unsafe aircraft and call for the highest safety standards to avoid another tragedy," Bassani said in a letter seen by Reuters.
The letter dated October 30 was sent following a two-day US Congress examination of Muilenburg. During the inspection, Muilenburg was asked many sharp questions related to the Boeing 737 MAX which was involved in the Lion Air and Ethiopian Airlines tragedy which killed a total of 346 people.
American Airlines Group is known to be the second most Boeing 737 MAX user, with 24 aircraft currently in its possession and dozens of other aircraft ordered.
Bassani said to Muilenburg that an examination at the US Congress showed a failure in overseeing the development of the Boeing 737 MAX and sparked questions about resources for oversight at the US Federal Aviation Authority (FAA).
